author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In Telefonica's German land,
Their earnings fell, 'twas not so grand,
Low growth, they say, is in God's plan,
For revenue and Oibda stand.

No value seen, twas understood,
In Germany's fine August Bund,
Citi spoke in voices meek,
Of auctions set for middle week.

Of spot gold, UOB did say,
It may climb high, o'er break of day,
Toward two thousand and a hundred fine,
In broad'ning wedge, the stars align.

feedItems.title: Telefonica Deutschland Earnings Fall Short
feedItems.description: Telefonica Deutschland reported below-forecast adjusted earnings in the first quarter and said it continued to expect low single-digit percentage year-on-year growth for revenue and Oibda.

feedItems.title: Little Relative Value Seen in Germany's August 2053 Bund Pre-Auction
feedItems.description: Germany’s 1.80% August 2053 Bund, one of the two ultra-long bonds to be auctioned on Wednesday, offers limited relative value both on the domestic curve and on cross-market basis, Citi said.

feedItems.title: Spot Gold May Rise Further Toward $2,100/oz
feedItems.description: Spot gold may rise further toward the top of an ascending and broadening wedge, which is now near $2,100/oz, based on the daily chart, said UOB.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In charms of silver, Sterling doth swell
Where BOE's rate, by measure, foretell
Of statures grand and lifts anew
To skies of yonder, Ebury's view

A tale of grandeur, Alstom's grace
With leaps in orders, wealth doth chase
Their earnings rise, in year so full
To margin six, their pockets pull

In lands afar, a Dutch stronghold
Ahold Delhaize, fortunes bold
Their gains in coin, so blessed by hands
By US lands, with bounteous lands

feedItems.title: Sterling Could Rise if BOE Signals Further Rate Increases
feedItems.description: Sterling could rise as the BOE is likely to raise interest rates by 25bp to 4.5% as expected on Thursday and potentially signal further increases, Ebury said.

feedItems.title: Alstom Meets Hopes as Orders Jump
feedItems.description: Alstom posted an 11% rise in full-year earnings as sales and orders grew and for fiscal 2024, targeted an adjusted EBIT margin of around 6% and “significantly positive” free cash flow.

feedItems.title: Ahold Delhaize Outperforms Thanks to a Strong U.S.
feedItems.description: Ahold Delhaize posted a slightly higher first-quarter net profit of €561 million, helped by a strong performance in the U.S., with net sales excluding gas rising 6.2%.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In days of yore amidst the steeple,
TUI's losses, once vast, now feeble,
Narrowed by the sun's embrace,
Ninety-six percent their pace.

Yet o'er the horizon, troubles fly,
Airbus 'gainst supply-chain fight,
Berenberg them shan't embrace,
Till fortunes change in swift-paced race.

From fertile fields and vineyards fair,
Credit Agricole profits wear,
Yet heart's lament, deep as the Sea,
Net outflows from Amundi flee.

feedItems.title: TUI Losses Narrow; Summer Bookings Rebound
feedItems.description: TUI reported a narrower underlying EBIT loss of EUR242 million for the second quarter as revenue improved, and said it expected summer bookings to be at 96% of prepandemic levels.

feedItems.title: Airbus Still Facing Supply-Chain Issues
feedItems.description: Airbus won’t be a short-term pick for Berenberg until a clear improvement in the supply-chain situation helps take the risk out of 24-month forward estimates.

feedItems.title: Credit Agricole Beats Hopes Despite Amundi Outflows
feedItems.description: Credit Agricole reported first-quarter net profit and revenue that came in above expectations despite net outflows of €9.7 billion at its asset management division.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In halls of iron, the chariot's kin,
Toyota's coffers swell with coin;
Ægir's winds breathe profit thine,
Upon the shores of sales entwine.

Siemens Healthineers woes befall,
Diminishing gains of yester-year;
Test-sales like leaves of autumn fall,
Maintains the mast, no trepidation they fear.

Mighty ABN AMRO 'mongst the fray,
With thunderous profits, a hearty call;
Froth of market swells ye margins gay,
Upon equity's shores they raise the wall.

feedItems.title: Toyota Motor's Net Profit Rose on Sales Recovery, Weaker Yen
feedItems.description: Toyota Motor’s fourth-quarter net profit rose 3.4%, thanks in part to a recovery in sales and a weaker yen.

feedItems.title: Siemens Healthineers Hit by Waning Covid-19 Test Sales
feedItems.description: Siemens Healthineers profits fell sharply in the second quarter, with adjusted earnings at €681 million, as demand for its Covid-19 products declined, but it maintained its full-year outlook.

feedItems.title: ABN AMRO Posts Solid Profit Beat
feedItems.description: ABN AMRO posted above-forecast profits in the first quarter, helped by improved deposit margins from higher interest rates and lower impairments and raised its long-term target for return on equity.
